page.title: 02ATTITUDES IN MARSKE AREA.
page.content: A feeling of satisfaction felt by residents at living in such an area. Two types of people Farmers & 'Incomers'living in happy association. Farmers fear decline in agriculture. A general opposition to Land Nationalisation. Local farming practices not considered a threat to the environment. Some grumbles about new farm buildings, state of roads, game shooting, army lorries & helicopters. Older people well occupied; most have cars & so not confined to area. Very old feel they can cope. Few money worries. Parents think integration with urban conditions will be easier for their children now being educated in towns. Have good opinion of schools. Some young people feel that more building might be a means of extending village life.
